Address: Kerrytown location, 226 N 4th Ave, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Local chain spot preparing noodles, stir-fries & other familiar Thai dishes in a low-key space.

summary.snippet: "Pad Thai and drunken noodles tasty flavorful and generous portion size."
"Rude service from cooking staff and cashier."
"Delicious food, large portions, seating, bathrooms, and clean dining room."

most_relevant.description: Want to thank them. We are big fans and it’s usually spot on- specifically this location is usually tastier and more reliable than the delivery spot- but on the rare occasion it is inconsistent they have made it right. Appreciate it and love the food!! No Thai for life!

I've tried their Drunken Noodles, which is pretty tasty even for an Asian food palette. The sweet tea tastes very interesting, with spicy noodles, the cold sweet tea balances your taste buds well. Overall it was a good experience for ~$20. Haven't tried other dishes, probably next time I'll get something else.

Fast and efficient service. I was in and out of there within 10 minutes. The food was made fresh and was hot and very tasty. I ordered the notai fried rice with medium spice chicken. Had very good flavor and a good spice to it
I also had Thai tea which was nice and sweet. I would recommend this place for anyone that wants to get some quick Thai food that is reliable and tasty. This is my third time coming here and I really enjoy this place.

The Pad Thai here is absolutely delicious. I love that there’s enough sauce so the noodles don’t dry out, and the sauce itself is so flavorful! It’s a little bit sweet, a but citrusy, and it balances well with the crushed peanuts. The green onions are cooked to tenderness, while still having a good bite. I keep coming back anytime I’m in town. So good!

I visited 4 different No Thai in the past 7 years many many times. This place had the best drunken fried rice I have ever had. Perfect amount of sauce, ingredients, and rice. I enjoyed every single bite.
Okay food and friendly service. Only the green curry is vegan as all the other dishes have fish sauce, but they let us sub in the curry sauce on other dishes. (Pictured: green curry w/ tofu)

The food was so good,  reasonable price large portions. Excellent and quick food preparation, it was made so promptly and delicious. This was a pretty popular location in a college town. It filled up quickly, and they were fast filling the orders.

3.5
No Thai! Will definitely give you your Thai fix but it’s not the most authentic experience- and many of the dishes are a Chinese fusion. Don’t sleep on the drunken noodles! The pad see-ew is a bit sweet! Everything was tasty and prepared quickly
